hints.content:
To find how many fewer $\blueE{\text{cats}}$ than $\purpleD{\text{dogs}}$ the animal shelter has, we need the difference.  So, we subtract.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/4716fcf857c4e5d7a23ac29f4b85308947f832a9)

$\purpleD{97} - \blueE{54} = \maroonD{\square}$

Let's subtract to find how many fewer cats.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/a07fff9dbdad5efe33e8136e26701d34413bde52)

$\purpleD{97} - \blueE{54} = \maroonD{43}$
The animal shelter has $\maroonD{43}$ fewer cats than dogs.

question.content:
The animal shelter has $54$ cats and $97$ dogs.  

**How many fewer cats than dogs does the animal shelter have?**  

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] fewer cats
